meanings.definition: Excessively particular or demanding in taste or standards.
meanings.sent1: She is overfastidious about the cleanliness of her room, always rearranging everything to perfection.
meanings.sent2: The overfastidious chef refused to serve the dish until it met his exacting standards.
meanings.sent3: The overfastidious cat refused to eat the food unless it was served in a specific bowl.
meanings.sent4: Her overfastidious nature when it comes to choosing clothes makes shopping with her a long and tedious process.
meanings.sent5: The overfastidious judge meticulously reviewed every detail of the case before making a decision.

meanings.sent1: His overfastidious approach to painting meant he spent hours perfecting each brushstroke.
meanings.sent2: The overfastidious student always double-checked every calculation to ensure accuracy.
meanings.sent3: The overfastidious planner color-coded every aspect of the event, from decorations to seating arrangements.
meanings.sent4: The overfastidious architect scrutinized every angle of the building design to achieve flawless symmetry.
meanings.sent5: The overfastidious editor meticulously combed through the manuscript, correcting even the smallest punctuation errors.
